title: Goldman Sachs raises its first-half 2026 Aluminum Price Forecast and adjusts surplus Outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its London Metal Exchange aluminum price forecast for the first half of 2026 to $3,150 per tonne from $2,575, citing low global inventories, doubts on Indonesian smelter power availability, and strong demand from EVs and grid expansion. LME aluminum traded at $3,180 per tonne after hitting a nearly three-year high. The bank expects prices not to stay above $3,000 long-term as supply growth accelerates while demand slows.

title: Aluminum - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Aluminum fell to 3,117.65 USD/T on January 30, 2026, down 3.49% from the previous day, retreating from a near four-year high of 3,296 USD/T on January 28. UK aluminum futures dropped to $3,100 per tonne amid base metals pullback as traders closed speculative positions. Over the past month, prices rose 4.06%, up 20.13% year-over-year.

title: US aluminium prices break away as tariffs collide with global supply strain
summary: US aluminum prices surged past $5,000 per tonne due to escalating tariffs up to 50%, falling imports, shrinking stocks, and Europe's supply disruptions from CBAM and Russian sanctions. US buyers pay a 68% premium over LME prices, with Midwest premium at $560 per tonne above tariff costs. This has led to shortages impacting automotive, aerospace, construction, and packaging industries.

title: The Proportion of Liquid Aluminum in January Declined, Expected to Face a Significant Drop in February (SMM Analysis)
summary: China's aluminum production in January 2026 increased 2.7% YoY and 0.5% MoM, but the proportion of liquid aluminum declined 4.4 percentage points to 72.1% due to weak demand, high prices, and production restrictions. As of end-January, existing capacity stood at 46.209 million mt and operating capacity at 44.996 million mt. February production is forecast to drop MoM with liquid aluminum proportion falling sharply to 64.4% amid Chinese New Year and high prices.

title: The proportion of liquid aluminium in January declined, expected to face a significant drop in February
summary: China's aluminium production in January 2026 rose 2.7% YoY and 0.5% MoM, with liquid aluminium proportion dropping 4.4 points to 72.1% from weak demand and restrictions. End-January capacity was 46.209 million tonnes existing and 44.996 million tonnes operating. February sees expected MoM production decline and liquid aluminium proportion at 64.4%.

title: Goldman Sachs raises its first-half 2026 Aluminum Price Forecast and adjusts surplus outlook
summary: Goldman Sachs raised its H1 2026 LME aluminum price forecast to $3,150/tonne from $2,575, citing low inventories, Indonesian smelter power doubts, and EV/grid demand growth. It revised 2026 surplus down to 0.8 million tonnes from 1.1 million. Prices hit near three-year highs amid supply tightness.

title: Is Alcoa's (AA) Aggressive 2026 Output Plan Reshaping Its Vertically Integrated Strategy?
summary: Alcoa reported higher 2025 aluminum production and issued 2026 guidance for increased alumina and aluminum output via productivity gains and smelter restarts. The company plans to ship more than it produces, relying on trading and external sources. This boosts price sensitivity but adds execution risks.

title: First aluminum plant to be built in US in almost 50 years to counter China
summary: A new primary aluminum smelter in Inola, Oklahoma, by EGA and Century Aluminum will produce 750,000 tonnes/year, doubling U.S. output and creating 1,000 jobs. It uses advanced EX technology to boost domestic supply amid 85% import reliance. China produced 44.2 million mt of global 73.78 million mt primary aluminum in 2025.

title: St. Louis-based EGA America's parent to build $4B Oklahoma facility with aluminum smelter
summary: Emirates Global Aluminium (EGA) and partners will build a $4B smelter in Oklahoma producing 750,000 tonnes annually, doubling U.S. production. Construction starts this year, expecting 1,000 permanent jobs. It aims to expand domestic aluminum capacity.

title: Aluminum output: Global body says production of primary aluminium up over 3% on month in Dec
summary: Global primary aluminium production rose over 3% month-on-month in December 2025, per international data. This reflects ongoing capacity utilization trends in the sector.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Pioneering Sustainability and Innovation
summary: The world's leading aluminum trade fair will take place October 6–8, 2026, in Düsseldorf, Germany, organized by RX Global. The event will emphasize sustainability, secondary aluminum's role in decarbonization, and innovations in metal processing, recycling, casting, automation, and surface finishing, with new elements including Hall 7A and dedicated sustainability conferences.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: ALUMINIUM 2026 will highlight sustainability as its central theme, with particular focus on secondary aluminum for decarbonization and coverage of metal processing, recycling, automation, and surface finishing. The event will feature proven formats like themed pavilions alongside fresh concepts for networking and business development.

title: Automotive Aluminum Market Analysis Report 2026 - Global Industry Size, Share, Trends, Opportunity and Forecast 2021-2031
summary: The automotive aluminum market is experiencing growth driven by electric vehicle electrification, with EVs using approximately 30% more aluminum than traditional vehicles. Innovations include gigacasting technology and crash management systems using over 90% post-consumer aluminum scrap, advancing both performance and sustainability.

title: Aluminum Symposium
summary: The premier annual aluminum industry event brings together 250+ attendees from 170+ companies to explore market dynamics, sustainability, and innovation trends. The symposium provides networking opportunities and insights on challenges and opportunities shaping the aluminum industry's future.

title: Steel Rises Toward 5-Month High
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,150 per tonne, approaching five-month highs of CNY 3,160 from January 7th. The rally was driven by efforts to improve the financial balance of Chinese property developers, which stoked optimism for ferrous metal demand.

title: HRC Steel Hits 36-week High
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel increased to 941.00 USD/T, marking the highest level since April 2025. Over the past 4 weeks, HRC Steel gained 2.87%, and in the last 12 months, it increased 31.63%.

title: Steelmaking Raw Material Prices Increase Through January
summary: Steelmaking raw materials experienced broad-based price increases in January, with coking coal, pig iron, scrap, zinc, and aluminum all rising. Collectively, prices rose 8% month-over-month, with seven of eight tracked products more expensive than three months ago and all higher than year-ago levels.

title: Feb 2026 Metals Market: Pricing, Supply & Buyer Insights
summary: Metals markets are experiencing price movements of 3–8% compared to Q4 2025 levels, driven by energy costs and alloy inputs. Mills are maintaining disciplined output while demand remains selective, keeping inventories tight and contributing to ongoing price volatility.

title: Hadeed Raises Rebar Prices for February 2026
summary: Hadeed adjusted rebar prices upward for February 2026, increasing prices for rebar sizes 12–32 mm by SAR 70 (USD 19) per ton to reach SAR 2,260 per ton (USD 603).

title: AISI: Raw steel production jumps to 20-week high
summary: US raw steel production reached 1,778,000 short tons in the week ending January 24, 2026, marking the highest rate in over four months. The mill capability utilization rate was 76.9%, up from 75.9% the previous week and 76.3% a year prior. Year-to-date production stands at 6,016,000 short tons, up 3.4% from the same period last year.

title: US raw steel production is up 2.8 percent - week 1, 2026
summary: According to the American Iron and Steel Institute, US domestic raw steel production for the week ending January 10, 2026, was 1.752 million net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 75.7%. Production increased 2.8% from the previous week and 3.1% compared to the same week in 2025.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News
summary: Copper futures dropped more than 3% to around $6 per pound on Friday, reversing a sharp rally amid profit-taking after surging to record levels. Copper fell to 5.97 USD/Lbs on January 30, 2026, down 3.80% from the previous day, despite monthly gains of 5.03% and yearly increase of 40.26%. The retreat aligned with a broader pullback in the metals complex and a rebounding dollar.

title: Copper Prices Are Tumbling, and a Larger Correction Could Be ...
summary: Copper prices hit a record above $14,000 per ton on Thursday but dropped sharply to around $13,800 on Friday, mirroring declines in gold and silver. Goldman Sachs warns of a potential larger correction in mid-2026, possibly triggered by US tariffs on refined copper. Analysts note speculation has driven prices beyond fundamentals, especially with soft demand in China.

title: Why is copper price down and will it rise again or continue to fall ...
summary: Copper prices fell after record highs due to profit-booking in Shanghai and London markets, with Shanghai futures down 2.82% to 103,680 yuan per ton and LME at $13,278.50 per ton. Weak Chinese demand is evident from low Yangshan premiums and spot discounts, alongside a stronger dollar. Long-term fundamentals remain positive with tight supply, potential rate cuts, and investor interest.

title: Glencore 2025 copper output falls 11%
summary: Glencore's copper production fell 11% in 2025 to 851,600 metric tonnes, though second-half output improved significantly due to higher grades and better recoveries at key mines. Rio Tinto has until February 5 to make a firm bid for Glencore, which could create the world's biggest miner controlling almost 10% of global copper output.

title: Copper gains ground, bolstering mining companies' 2026 profits outlook
summary: Copper is expected to account for over 35% of diversified miners' earnings in 2026. Rio Tinto has increased copper output by 54% since 2019 following the Oyu Tolgoi project ramp-up, significantly outpacing competitors like BHP's 11% increase.

title: [SMM Announcement] on publishing Copper grade 1 cathode premium, ddp Midwest US on February 1, 2026
summary: Shanghai Metals Market officially launched the Copper grade 1 cathode premium pricing for delivery to the Midwest US on February 1, 2026.

title: Northstar Gold Corp. Announces $4 Million Digital Co-Investment to Advance Cam Copper and Novamera's Surgical Mining
summary: Northstar Gold Corp. has secured a $4 million digital co-investment to advance its Cam Copper Project using Novamera's Surgical Mining technology. This innovative approach targets mineralized zones from surface with large-diameter rotary drill holes, reducing waste, surface disturbance, and permitting timelines compared to conventional mining. The project promotes sustainable extraction of critical minerals like copper.

title: Nuton: A faster, cleaner way to produce copper
summary: Rio Tinto's Nuton technology is enabling the Johnson Camp mine to become the lowest-carbon primary copper producer, setting a new benchmark for sustainability. The technology drives cleaner and faster copper production. It applies to stockpiles for residual copper extraction without new major developments.

title: Nickel Eases from 19-Month High
summary: Nickel futures eased to $18,500 per tonne from a 19-month high of $19,000 in late January. Markets are assessing lower supply from major producers after Indonesia signaled output cuts by reducing mining permits to 260 million wet tonnes. Despite the recent dip, contracts remain sharply higher year-to-date amid supply risks.

title: Nickel fell to 17,555 USD/T on January 30, 2026
summary: Nickel prices dropped 5.21% to 17,555 USD/T on January 30, 2026, after sinking to $17,700 per tonne due to a rebounding dollar closing speculative positions in base metals. Over the past month, prices rose 4.81%, and year-over-year they are up 15.27%. UK nickel futures hovered near $19,000 throughout January before the decline.

title: Nickel is down by 5.03%
summary: Nickel decreased 5.03% to 17,588 USD/T on January 30, 2026. This follows a pullback from recent highs amid broader base metals weakness. Year-to-date gains persist due to supply concerns.

title: The nickel production of Nornickel Russia in 2026 is expected to be similar to the previous year
summary: Nornickel of Russia expects its nickel production to reach 193,000-203,000 metric tons in 2026, roughly in line with 2025 output of 198,521 tonnes. The company attributes slight reductions to a temporary rise in disseminated ore percentages and is upgrading mining equipment while starting construction at Skalisty Mine to restore rich ore production. CEO Vladimir Potanin described the decline as temporary, with no plans for artificial cuts.

title: TRADE REVIEW: Asian nickel market faces Q1 pressure as oversupply outweighs output cuts
summary: The Asian nickel market will face pressure in Q1 2026 due to oversupply despite Indonesia's mining controls, with limited battery demand upside from a shift to nickel-free LFP batteries. S&P Global projects a 179,000 mt surplus through 2026. Indonesia plans to reduce nickel output, but new HPAL projects could add over 400,000 mt/y of MHP capacity.

title: Nickel Supply Squeeze Intensifies as Indonesia Restricts Exports and Canada Accelerates Projects
summary: Nickel prices surged to $18,650 per ton after Vale's Indonesian mining halt due to permit delays enforcing export restrictions, validating demand via rises in nickel pig iron and stainless steel prices. Canada Nickel's Crawford project gains fast-track approval as an alternative supply source, while the Reid deposit resource grows 46% to 5 million tonnes of contained nickel. Q1 constraints from Philippines and Indonesia may push prices to $20,000/ton by March.

title: Nickel price extends drop amid lack of detail on Indonesia output cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell up to 5.9% from a 19-month high after Indonesia provided no details on its pledged output cuts at a press briefing, despite earlier surges to $18,800/ton on supply risk bets. The Energy and Mineral Resources Ministry is finalizing 2026 quotas to balance supply and demand. Prices have risen 20% since mid-December amid Chinese buying and geopolitical concerns.

title: Indonesia quota talk triggers nickel reality check
summary: Nickel prices surged on speculation of Indonesia slashing 2026 ore quotas to 250 million tonnes from 379 million in 2025, potentially removing 700,000 tonnes of supply and flipping the market to deficit. However, analysts question feasibility due to limited processing capacity outside China and years-long timelines for new Western mines. BMO notes the Indonesian Nickel Miners Association's commentary driving the rally.

title: Indonesia caps 2026 nickel output while APNI warns of financial pressure on miners
summary: Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources set the 2026 nickel production quota at 250-260 million tons. The quota aligns output levels amid market pressures. APNI warns of financial strain on miners from the cap.

title: Indonesia Dominates Global Nickel Market & Supply Chain
summary: Indonesia's 2026 nickel production quota drops 34% to 250-260 million wet tons from 379 million in 2025. This reduction underscores Indonesia's control over the global nickel supply chain. The change aims to address oversupply issues.

title: The growing role of critical minerals in global innovation
summary: Leaders at the World Economic Forum Annual Meeting 2026 will discuss balancing environmental protection with economic growth in critical minerals mining, including nickel for EVs. Demand for these minerals is projected to rise over 3.4 times by 2040 to achieve net zero by 2050. The article emphasizes responsible mining practices to build trust through environmental stewardship and community benefits.[1]

title: Advancing Nickel MMC Coatings: Electroplating Models, Tooling Innovations for Hard Chromium Alternatives
summary: The EU-funded MOZART project develops nickel dispersion coatings with nanoparticles as a sustainable alternative to hard chromium plating, achieving hardness up to 1,000 HV. It addresses challenges in traditional electroplating models by integrating electrochemical characterization and CAE technology to predict nanoparticle content. The initiative includes custom plating tooling for real-world demonstrators to replace hard chromium in industrial applications.[2]

title: Green Nickel, Global Future
summary: Neo Energy is transforming Indonesia's nickel industry by integrating mining, processing, and industrial development into a sustainable model. This approach aims to redefine the sector's global role with a focus on environmental responsibility and innovation. The initiative positions Indonesia as a leader in green nickel production for future technologies.[3]
